intro: Hieracium vierhapperi, commonly known as the Vierhapper's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium vierhapperi is noted for its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in drier conditions.
